intro: Scabiosa atropurpurea var. maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its spiny, leaf-like bracts that surround its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and full sun, making it well adapted to coastal environments. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for gardeners looking to add texture and color to their landscapes. It is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
